content: Singaporean singer, songwriter, and record producer **Peter Lee Shih Shiong** ([Chinese](/wiki/Chinese_language): 李偲菘; [pinyin](/wiki/Pinyin): *Lǐ Sīsōng*; born 24 July 1966) is a [Singaporean](/wiki/Singaporeans) musician, composer, and record producer. In 2001, Lee won a [Golden Melody Award](/wiki/Golden_Melody_Awards) for Best Composition for his work, "Cloudy Day", performed by his apprentice [Stefanie Sun](/wiki/Stefanie_Sun). ## Musical career In 2006, Lee, with his brother, opened the Lee Wei Song Music School in Shanghai. They opened another branch in Beijing in 2010. ## Personal life Lee has a twin brother, Lee Wei Shiong. ## Awards and nominations YearAwardResult**2001**[Special Achievement Award](/wiki/Star_Awards_for_Special_Achievement_Award)Won - Peter Lee at [IMDb](/wiki/IMDb_(identifier)) - Peter Lee on [Weibo](/wiki/Weibo) (in Chinese) This Singaporean biographical article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e This article about a Singaporean musician is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Peter Lee (musician)
